data.text:
Siva Hotel Sharm el Sheikh..

We left the hotel room for the city at about 8:00 p.m. and returned at about 10:00 p.m.. the water was flowing a couple of rooms ahead, nobody is cleaning anywhere, the corridor was still flooded, unfortunately I didn't take a picture of the entire corridor..
All of our rags were flooded, all the adapters are a mess, her wallet, which was in the suitcase, was also flooded.
Darkness falls on the eyes.. WHERE ARE THE CLEANERS, JANICEMEN?!
I go to the reception and the man says to me, this is on the 6th floor, right?
Total disaster, YOU KNOW YOUR FLOOR IS FLOORING BUT YOU DON'T HAVE WATER PURIFIERS DOWN YOU DIDN'T SHUT OFF THE WATER THEY WERE FLOWING FULLY NO ONE FIXED THE ISSUE?!
NO ONE EVEN CALLED ME TO TRY TO SOLVE ANYTHING!
Anyway, they have a universal card and could open the room and just pick up what's on the floor?!
The adapters were in the socket, and the cable was in the water, good thing there was no electric shock!

Everywhere you turn, you come across empty ears.. they offer a cleaning service for rags.. they change the room.. when I get to the room, the bed linen is brown from what?! Clean sheets?! And I should wash T-shirts in this dry cleaner (and I'm not bragging, I'm just saying), which are also of a higher price class.

None of this would have happened if they had changed my hotel, as I asked in the morning, or if they had at least called a man in the hotel to water his room!

The hotel was presented as better than average and the food average, we wanted to go to another hotel, but we were told that this one was better, so we immediately decided on this one without any prior inspection (I know my mistake)..and as I said before here realized the mistake and wanted to pay extra for a better hotel.
data.title: WORST HOTEL EXPERIENCE EVER.
